description: Mississauga is a young, vibrant, and thriving city in the heart of one of the most exciting and prosperous regions in North America.
Brampton is Canada's 9th largest city, moving from a small population of 500 in 1853, to 656,480 in 2021. It is the fastest growing of Canada's largest 25 cities.
Vaughan is a vibrant and prosperous community and one of Canada's fastest growing cities.
The City of Vancouver is a coastal, seaport city on the mainland of British Columbia.
Abbotsford is a city located in British Columbia, adjacent to the Canada–United States border, Greater Vancouver and the Fraser River
The City of Surrey is the largest city by land area and second most populated in Metro Vancouver

Saint John is a seaport city of the Atlantic Ocean located on the Bay of Fundy in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. Saint John is the oldest incorporated city in Canada, established by royal charter on May 18, 1785, during the reign of King George III.

With a population of nearly 17,000 residents, the municipality of Edmundston, New Brunswick is the largest service centre north of Fredericton. This city is known for its dynamism, creativity and openness.

Situated in the Petitcodiac River Valley, Moncton lies at the geographic centre of the Maritime Provinces. The city has earned the nickname Hub City because of its central inland location in the region and its history as a railway and land transportation hub for the Maritimes.

It is the only remaining walled city in North America north of Mexico and was recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1985. Among its other distinguishing characteristics are its narrow cobblestone streets, stone buildings, fortifications, and rich French Canadian culture grounded in the French language.
Montreal is a major industrial centre, commercial and financial metropolis, railway and maritime bridgehead, and one of the centres of francophone culture in North America.
Located in the vicinity of the river and facing Quebec City, Lévis offers exceptional panoramic views. It is the main urban, business, and manufacturing centre of the Chaudière-Appalaches region.
Kensington is a Canadian town located in Prince County, Prince Edward Island. It is 15 km (9.3 mi) northeast of the city of Summerside. In 2021, its population was 1,812.
Known as the Heart of West Prince, the small town of Alberton is located in Prince County on the northwest shore of the Island.
The Town of Cornwall is located in Queens County immediately to the west of Prince Edward Island's capital and largest city, Charlottetown.
Watson Lake is a small lake city in southern Yukon, Canada.
Haines Junction is a small lake city in southern Yukon, Canada
Faro is a small lake city in southern Yukon, Canada
Norman Wells is an historic town of about 800 nestled between the Mackenzie River and the Franklin Mountains.
Fort Simpson is the regional centre of the Dehcho and is the gateway to the scenic South Nahanni River and the Nahanni National Park Reserve.
The City of Winnipeg is located at the junction of the Red and Assiniboine Rivers, almost at the geographic centre of North America.
Selkirk is one of the oldest royal burghs in Scotland, with a history dating back to before the 12th century. The town name is a combination of old Scots words meaning 'the church in the forest'.
Portage la Prairie is a city of over 13,000 people (2016) in the Central Plains region of Manitoba.
Kugluktuk is a stunning community located at the mouth of the Coppermine River.
Gjoa Haven is a famous natural harbour 250 km above the Arctic Circle, with its adjacent hamlet, on the southeast coast of King William Island, in Nunavut.
A small, scenic village where a big lake meets a bay—Teslin is an enjoyable stop for travellers looking for history, culture and nature.
Swift Current is the fifth largest city in the Canadian province of Saskatchewan.
Yorkton is a city located in south-eastern Saskatchewan, Canada
Moose Jaw is an industrial centre and important railway junction for the area's agricultural produce
It is the financial centre of western Canada, based on its key role in the development of the region's oil and gas industry.
Edmonton is the fifth largest city in Canada and the capital city of the province of Alberta.
Lethbridge is known for its bright sunshine (more than 320 days per year), warm summers, and mild winters thanks to our semi-arid climate and Chinook winds.
Fort Smith is a town in the South Slave Region of the Northwest Territories (NWT), Canada.
Labrador City is a town in western Labrador (part of the Canadian province of Newfoundland and Labrador), near the Quebec border.
Mount Pearl is known as a city within a park. Enjoy over 60 parks, playgrounds, and trails, as well as a swimming pool, fitness centre and skating arena.
Paradise is a town on the Avalon Peninsula in the province of Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. Paradise is the third largest settlement in the province .
The Halifax Regional Municipality (HRM) is the vibrant, thriving economic hub of Canada's East Coast.

New Glasgow is a beautiful riverside town of 9,562 residents, located in northern Nova Scotia, which serves as the commercial-service centre for the region of Pictou County with a population of 45,643.

Truro is a cathedral city and civil parish in Cornwall, England. It is Cornwall's county town, sole city and centre for administration, leisure and retail trading. Its population was 18,766 in the 2011 census. People of Truro can be called Truronians
